benefits.title: Vitamin and Mineral Supplements in the Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease and Cancer: An Updated Systematic Evidence Review for the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force
benefits.summary: Multivitamin supplements may have a small, borderline-significant benefit on cancer in men only, but no effect on cardiovascular disease.

benefits.title: Effect of a Multivitamin and Mineral Supplement on Infection and Quality of Life
benefits.summary: Multivitamin and mineral supplements appear to reduce infections in people with type 2 diabetes mellitus, a group at risk for micronutrient deficiency.

benefits.title: Improved Blood Biomarkers but No Cognitive Effects from 16 Weeks of Multivitamin Supplementation in Healthy Older Adults
benefits.summary: Multivitamin supplementation improved blood biomarkers relevant to cognition, but did not improve cognitive function in healthy older adults.

benefits.title: Memory improvements in elderly women following 16 weeks treatment with a combined multivitamin, mineral and herbal supplement
benefits.summary: Multivitamin supplementation may improve working memory in elderly women at risk of cognitive decline.

benefits.title: Addressing nutritional gaps with multivitamin and mineral supplements
benefits.summary: Multivitamin and mineral supplements may help prevent conditions like anemia, neural tube defects, osteoporosis, cancer, cataract, and improve cognitive performance.

benefits.title: Recent developments in multivitamin/mineral research.
benefits.summary: Recent randomized clinical trials show potential benefits of multivitamin/mineral supplements on improving cognitive performance and mental well-being of healthy populations.

benefits.title: A Role for Multivitamins in Infection?
benefits.summary: Multivitamin and mineral supplements significantly reduced infection-related illnesses and infection-related absenteeism from work among healthy persons 45 years of age or older.

benefits.title: Clinical trials of vitamin and mineral supplements for cancer prevention.
benefits.summary: Multivitamin supplements may decrease the risk of cancer, particularly stomach cancer, but results in large-scale trials have been mixed.
benefits.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

benefits.title: Multivitamin/mineral supplements and prevention of chronic disease.
benefits.summary: Multivitamin/mineral supplement use may prevent cancer in individuals with poor or suboptimal nutritional status, but have no benefit in preventing cardiovascular disease or cataract.

benefits.title: Acute mood but not cognitive improvements following administration of a single multivitamin and mineral supplement in healthy women aged 50 and above: a randomised controlled trial
benefits.summary: A single multivitamin, mineral, and herbal supplement reduces stress several hours after intake in healthy older people.

side effects.title: The effects of multivitamins and minerals on children with Down syndrome.
side effects.summary: High-dose multivitamin and mineral supplements were associated with decreased developmental progress and various side-effects, but parents observed improvement in general appearance and skin freshness.

side effects.title: Prevalence and Predictors of Dietary and Nutritional Supplement Use in the Australian Army: A Cross-Sectional Survey
side effects.summary: Approximately 16% of regular dietary supplement users reported experiencing side effects like palpitations (10.6%), tingling or numbness in the face, fingers, arms, or legs (5.5%), tremors or shaking (2.9%), flushing (2.3%), headache (2.0%), abdominal pain (1.6%)

side effects.title: Factors Affecting Patient Adherence to Multivitamin Intake After Bariatric Surgery: a Multicentre Survey Study from the Patient’s Perspective
side effects.summary: Gastrointestinal side effects (25.6%) and unpleasant taste or smell (22.7%) are common reasons for inconsistent multivitamin use and non-use after bariatric surgery.

side effects.title: Nutritional Supplements & Athletes- An Analysis of Potential Side Effects
side effects.summary: Multivitamins are commonly consumed by athletes, with common side effects including dry mouth, constipation, insomnia, nausea, and heart palpitations.
side effects.journal: THE SKY-International Journal of Physical Education and Sports Sciences (IJPESS)

side effects.title: Attitude and practice regarding the use of multivitamins for hair fall: Cross sectional study in Saudi Arabia
side effects.summary: Side effects such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, and constipation were observed in 18.5% of the participants who used multivitamins for hair fall treatment.
side effects.journal: The Egyptian Journal of Hospital Medicine

side effects.title: Folic acid — vitamin and panacea or genetic time bomb?
side effects.summary: Increased exposure to micronutrients, such as folic acid, may introduce a strong genetic selection pressure, potentially increasing the prevalence of life-threatening diseases.

side effects.title: Do specialized bariatric multivitamins lower deficiencies after RYGB?
side effects.summary: Specialized multivitamin supplements resulted in less deficiencies of vitamin B12, vitamin D, folic acid, and ferritin in Roux-en-Y gastric bypass patients.
side effects.journal: Surgery for obesity and related diseases : official journal of the American Society for Bariatric Surgery

side effects.title: Vitamins, Are They Safe?
side effects.summary: High-dose supplements of vitamins A, E, D, C, and folic acid may not always be effective for disease prevention and can even be harmful to the health.

side effects.title: Vitamin and mineral status of trained athletes including the effects of supplementation.
side effects.summary: Multivitamin and mineral supplementation was without any measurable ergogenic effect and was without signs or symptoms of serious toxic side effects.
side effects.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Peripheral neuropathy after disulfiram administration: reversibility despite continued therapy.
dosage.summary: Continued disulfiram administration at a lower daily dosage (125 mg) in conjunction with multivitamin therapy led to marked improvement in symptoms and signs of peripheral neuropathy.

dosage.title: Effects of Multivitamin Supplements on Cognitive Function, Serum Homocysteine Level, and Depression of Korean Older Adults With Mild Cognitive Impairment in Care Facilities.
dosage.summary: Multivitamin supplements were taken at a dosage of one pill every day for 12 weeks through the oral route.
dosage.journal: Journal of nursing scholarship : an official publication of Sigma Theta Tau International Honor Society of Nursing

dosage.title: [Iron absorption after oral application of a combination of Fe2+-succinate and multivitamins (author's transl)].
dosage.summary: The dosage of multivitamins in this study was 330 mg ferrous succinate (115 mg Fe2+).

dosage.title: Safety assessment of a new multivitamin.
dosage.summary: Dosages of up to 249.3 mg/kg body weight/day of this multivitamin do not cause chronic toxicity in animals and may be safe for long-term consumption to enhance health.
dosage.journal: Food and chemical toxicology : an international journal published for the British Industrial Biological Research Association

dosage.title: The effects of multivitamins and minerals on children with Down syndrome.
dosage.summary: High-dosage multivitamin and mineral supplements were associated with decreased developmental progress and various side-effects in children with Down syndrome.

dosage.title: Randomized Controlled Trial Examining the Effects of Fish Oil and Multivitamin Supplementation on the Incorporation of n-3 and n-6 Fatty Acids into Red Blood Cells
dosage.summary: The incorporation of LC n-3 PUFA into red blood cells was influenced by dosage, the concurrent intake of vitamin/minerals, and gender.

dosage.title: Plasma-Saturating Intakes of Vitamin C Confer Maximal Antioxidant Protection to Plasma
dosage.summary: The antioxidant protection afforded by short-term vitamin C supplementation is maximal at the 500–1000 mg dosage range.
dosage.journal: Journal of the American College of Nutrition

dosage.title: The effects of folic acid supplementation on plasma total homocysteine are modulated by multivitamin use and methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase genotypes.
dosage.summary: Both dosages of folic acid supplements (1 or 2 mg) lowered total homocysteine levels similarly.

dosage.title: A randomized trial to determine the optimal dosage of multivitamin supplements to reduce adverse pregnancy outcomes among HIV-infected women in Tanzania.
dosage.summary: Multivitamin supplements at a single dose of the RDA may be as efficacious as multiple doses of the RDA in decreasing the risk of adverse pregnancy outcomes among HIV-infected women.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: The effects of an oral multivitamin combination with calcium, magnesium, and zinc on psychological well-being in healthy young male volunteers: a double-blind placebo-controlled trial
dosage.summary: One tablet daily of Berocca® significantly reduces anxiety and perceived stress.
